image.altText: A damaged building after an earthquake

props.synopsis: A magnitude-7.7 earthquake has struck Mandalay, the second-largest city in Myanmar, with the effects felt as far as Thailand and Vietnam. Follow live.

title.children: Skyscraper collapses in Bangkok after magnitude-7.7 earthquake hits Myanmar

image.altText: Deep cracks seen in a roadway while motorcyclists stand stationary with their vehicles

props.synopsis: The magnitude-7.7 earthquake hit near Mandalay in central Myanmar, according to the US Geological Survey, at a depth of only 10 kilometres.

title.children: Tremors from Myanmar earthquake felt across South-East Asia

image.altText: The tail of a plane and a large plume of dust/smoke

props.synopsis: Emergency services rushed to the air show at Avalon, south-west of Melbourne.

title.children: Pilot critically injured in plane crash at Australian International Airshow

image.altText: An illustration of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton, surrounded by icons such as a smoke stack, money and a shop.

props.synopsis: Keep up with all the major commitments promised by Labor and the Coalition as they campaign for Australia's vote.

title.children: The key election promises from Labor and the Coalition

image.altText: Liquified natural gas plant and LNG ship on Curtis Island, Queensland

props.synopsis: Experts say the time to establish a gas reservation policy has passed, and plans to bring more gas online are years away and will fail to provide immediate relief to power prices.

title.children: Experts poke holes in Peter Dutton's gas plan, saying 'the horse has bolted'

image.altText: Election called blog thumbnail

props.synopsis: After months of speculation, Anthony Albanese officially pulled the trigger on the election campaign, announcing Australians will be heading to the polls in 36 days' time.

title.children: Party leaders wrap first day of campaigning after Albanese pulls the trigger for May 3 poll

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: There's little Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton don't know about each other's political instincts. They now find themselves in a high-stakes battle where only one can prove victorious.

title.children: They've been in parliament for decades. That could be over in weeks

image.altText: An aerial photo of a vacant block of land in Haberfield, near Sydney.

props.synopsis: The sale of 18 plots of land in the inner-city suburb of Haberfield brought in more than $44 million on Thursday. The government first subdivided the plot in 2003 to auction off, but concerns about flooding held up the sale and it's taken decades to address concerns about the site.

title.children: After two decades, Defence finally sells prime Sydney land for $40m

image.altText: CCTV camera frame on a street intersection, woman in with a headscarf is approached by a man dressed all in black with a hood.

props.synopsis: Rumeysa Öztürk is the latest pro-Palestinian activist to be arrested in the Trump administration’s crackdown on immigrants.

title.children: This student was arrested by masked officials. Here's why it's shocked the US

image.altText: A photo of a child with a measles rash on their face.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's measles outbreak is continuing to worsen, with seven cases now confirmed this year, while New South Wales has issued a measles alert.

title.children: Measles outbreak worsens, triggering 'intense' contact tracing effort

image.altText: Green, red and yellow houses seen on the side of a white, snowy mountain alongside dark blue oceanwater

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has been calling for America to take over Greenland, a proposal the Danish PM has rejected outright. Here's what we know.

title.children: Donald Trump is obsessed with Greenland. Here is why

image.altText: Blues AFL players celebrate a goal against the Bulldogs.

props.synopsis: Carlton is yet to taste victory this AFL season, while the Western Bulldogs are aiming to rebound from last week's narrow loss to Collingwood. Follow live.

title.children: Winless Blues make blistering start against Bulldogs

image.altText: A man runs the ball during an NRL match

props.synopsis: The Dolphins and Broncos face off at Lang Park in the latest instalment in their Battle of Brisbane rivalry after the Titans' 30-12 victory over the Roosters in Sydney. Follow live.

title.children: Brisbane lights up with Dolphins-Broncos clash after Titans beat Roosters

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 74' Tino strolls over to seal win for Titans

image.altText: Aerial view of flooding

props.synopsis: Outback Queenslanders are being flown to safety by local pilots in a growing flood emergency now threatening a third of the state.

title.children: Choppers evacuate dozens as flooding threatens a third of Qld

image.altText: a backpacker standing next to a car.

props.synopsis: A stoush has broken out between working tourists and residents of an upmarket part of Albany, southern WA, over public facilities at one of the city's most popular beaches.

title.children: Council launches fines blitz on travellers 'hogging' public facilities

image.altText: Red fireworks over the Beijing Olympic stadium

props.synopsis: Brisbane has put its cards down on the table for its showpiece stadiums ahead of the 2032 Olympics. But how do the planned venues stack up against previous Games?

title.children: How Brisbane's proposed 2032 Olympic stadium bucks a domestic trend

image.altText: A collage of political images, badges and merch in different colours

props.synopsis: The date is set, and here’s your cheat sheet to the 2025 Australian federal election.

title.children: The election has been called. What happens now?

image.altText: A close-up shot of a voter's hand dropping a ballot paper into a purple ballot box at a polling booth.

props.synopsis: With marginal seats everywhere and a range of third party challenges, there are plenty of storylines to watch.

title.children: In an election where anything can happen, these seats matter most

props.synopsis: Reality TV editors sometimes go as far as forming new sentences from individual words, according to an editor and a former contestant.

title.children: How much can editors get away with on shows like MAFS?

image.altText: chocolate aisle in a supermarket with yellow price tags next to each product

props.synopsis: Australians are eating more red meat and poultry while cutting back on sweet treats, according to a new report released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS).

title.children: Australia's chocolate consumption declines for the first time in years

image.altText: An aerial view of Telstra Tower on Black Mountain.

props.synopsis: Federal election campaigns usually don't give much consideration to Canberra, but the Coalition has committed to making cutbacks through a hiring freeze on public service jobs if elected.

title.children: Plan to cut public servant jobs could be 'disastrous', Pocock says

image.altText: A notice says "$500,000 reward" above pictures of a woman.

props.synopsis: Cleaners found Tanya Glover's body in the wall of a storage facility in an Alderley apartment complex in December 2022.

title.children: Woman charged with murder of Tanya Glover, whose body was found in wall

image.altText: A person wearing a grey hoodie pulled over his head and a black face mask carries a parcel and stares off screen at night.

props.synopsis: Police allege the man forced the woman to drive around Melbourne's south-east to buy laptops while he kept her baby with him in the car.

title.children: Man charged with 2024 abduction of mother, baby from shopping centre

image.altText: A view of a bay of turquoise and darker blue water, and a white sand beach.

props.synopsis: New figures suggest last year's turmoil dealt a severe blow to New Caledonia's population, as French nationals left the territory in search of jobs or to escape violence.

title.children: 'Everything collapsed': Why thousands have left a Pacific paradise

image.altText: Christian Horner, team principal of Red Bull Racing, looking over at driver Liam Lawson, who is looking at a screen

props.synopsis: Liam Lawson has suffered one of the more ruthless axings in Formula 1, and his replacement will need to overcome a temperamental car and a dysfunctional team or be at risk of a similar fate.

title.children: Lawson's F1 axing makes him a scapegoat for Red Bull's problems

image.altText: Josh Giddey shouts in joy as Chicago Bulls teammates embrace him after a game-winning NBA shot.

props.synopsis: Australian star Josh Giddey continues his phenomenal run of form with a long-range buzzer beater to take down LeBron James and the Lakers in their NBA clash.

title.children: Giddey nails NBA game-winner over LeBron from beyond halfcourt

image.altText: Untitled Photo - 2025-03-28 12:53:05

props.synopsis: Touted as being potential top-four material before the start of the season, Fremantle head in the 60th western derby in desperate need of a win against bitter rivals West Coast.

title.children: Do or die for Fremantle in the 60th derby clash with Eagles

image.altText: Queensland batters Jack Wildermuth and Jack Clayton shake hands during the Sheffield Shield final.

props.synopsis: Jack Clayton and Jack Wildermuth both score centuries to help Queensland set South Australia a record 270 runs to win the Sheffield Shield final at Karen Rolton Oval.

title.children: Pair of Qld centuries set SA record run chase in Shield final

image.altText: Older man in a suit wearing a a suit and waving

props.synopsis: King Charles is forced to cancel public engagements after being taken to hospital due to side effects from his ongoing cancer treatment, Buckingham Palace says.

title.children: Palace says king was hospitalised with cancer treatment side effects

image.altText: Beachscape at Kiama

props.synopsis: Investigators have confirmed the discovery on the NSW south coast but are sharing few other details. The ABC understands several people were at the beach at the time, including a boat close to shore.

title.children: Police remain tight-lipped after bundles of cash wash up on beach

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The former police officer was convicted of manslaughter after he tasered the great-grandmother in 2023.

title.children: Family says ex-police officer got 'slap on the wrist' for taser death of 95yo

image.altText: Flinders Ranges in South Australia

props.synopsis: Native title holders in South Australia's Flinders Ranges have secured the right to access financial records showing how tens of millions of dollars in mining royalties have been spent.

title.children: Native title holders win right to see records of mining millions
